result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. Brand was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tyler J. Brand in court by video from Jackson Correctional, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 8:37 a.m. Def's motion for additional jail credit. Court has reviewed Def's petition and advises that the Court at time of sentencing did reserve Def's right to address credit.Def was given credit for 297 days and believes credit should be for 711 days. Statement by Def. Response by State. After reviewing history of case believes correct amount of credit should be for 671 days. Def does not object to that amount. On 14CF240, Court orders amended JOC with credit for 671 days of presentence credit. Copy to be provided to DOC.
Hearing on September 20, 2017 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Tyler J. Brand
Current: P.O. Box 233, Jackson Correctional Institution, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 06-22-2017)
Prior: W6136 Apache Road, Wild Rose, WI
Def.'s in Support of His Motion for Sentence Credit
Def.'s for Sentence Credit Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 973.155
Sentencing After Revocation held 10-13-16 - see 12CF164
Def's JU, NEJ, NOC to Langlade Co Jail
See 12-CF-164
See 12CF164

Defendant Tyler J. Brand in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Defendant Tyler J. Brand in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 12CF164 & 14CF240 @ 3:40 pm.  State has reviewed revocation summary packet and no corrections. Atty Kohn and def. has reviewed revocation summary packet and no corrects. State gives sentencing arguments.  14CF240 6 years prison, 3 yrs i.c. & 3 yrs e.s. 12CF164 7 yrs prison, 3 yr i.c. & 4 yrs e.s and current with 14CF240.  State does not have accurate credit.  Atty Kohn heard on credit.  Parties to prepare petition on detail of credit.  Atty Kohn heard on credit figure out later date.  Atty Kohn gives sentencing arguments. 14CF240 2 years in, 2 years out.  12CF164 Same time as 14CF240 concurrent.  14CF240 1 year credit.  Atty Kohn submit letter from another inmate.  Court reviewed letter from inmate.  Def. makes statement. 
Court orders 12CF164 Ct 3 - 5  years prison,  2 1/2 years initial confinement & 2 1/2  years extended supervision, 119 days credit time served. 
14CF240 ct 1 - 5  years prison, 2 1/2 years initial confinement  2 1/2 years extended supervision, concurrent with 12CF164, 297 days credit
Def. is not eligible for Challenge and Substance Abuse Program.  Sex Offender Registry on 14CF240 and eligible on 12CF164
Def. advised of postconviction rights.  Court costs converted to civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
see 12CF164
Revocation Packet Summary - see 12CF164

Defendant Tyler J. Brand in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Tyler J. Brand in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 12CF164 and 14CF240 @ 2:43 p.m. 12CF164 sentencing on ct 3 only. 14CF240 Agreement stated - State moves to amend ct 1 to 948.055(1) exposing child to harmful material, for reasons stated. Withheld sentence, 5 yrs probation, sex offender evaluation and treatment, no contact w/victim, no unsupervised contact w/ minor females, additional 6 months jail w/no credit for time served, register as sex offender for 15 yr. State has complied with VWNR. Court costs. Cts 2, 3, & 4 dismiss and read in. Atty Laufenberg agrees, asks for huber privileges. Def agrees. Plea quest. reviewed. Court grants motion to amend ct 1. Plea to amended charge - no contest. Cts 2, 3, & 4 dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements and penalties reviewed. Atty Laufenberg satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. State makes statement regarding factual basis. Atty Laufenberg concurs, makes statement. Court finds factual basis and accepts plea. Finds guilty of ct 1 as amended. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. State clarifies that jail time is consecutive to any other sentence currently serving. Response by Atty Laufenberg. Atty Laufenberg will determine any credit if revoked and submit to Court. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Court orders 5 yrs probation, withheld prison sentence. Conditions of probation - sex offender evaluation and follow up and treatment, no contact w/victim, no unsupervised contact w/any minor females, 6 months jail, consecutive to any other jail sentence serving. Reserve credit if revoked to be supplemented by Atty Laufenberg. Register as sex offender for 15 yrs. Court costs. Not ordering DNA sample under new statute, however may be required, Court defers to DOC. Jail may be served with huber privileges.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def advised of voting and firearms restrictions. Postconviction rights. 
12CF164 called @ 3:20 p.m. Same appearances. Joint recommendation on ct 3 - Withheld sentence, 5 yrs probation, concurrent, restitution amt tbd, court costs, counseling as deemed appropriate. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Court orders withheld prison sentence, 5 yrs probation, concurrent, restitution - State has 60 days to determine amt, reserve right to restitution hrg, court costs, counseling as required, Court will depart from agreement and order some jail time. Statement by Atty Laufenberg regarding jail time. Remarks by the Court, orders additional 30 days jail as condition of probation, consecutive to any other sentence serving. Postconviction rights.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Credit if revoked being held open. Voting and firearms restrictions. Huber privileges.

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  14CF240 & 12CF164 @ 2:12 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Tyler J. Brand in court, in custody with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 12CF164, 12CF134, 12CM194, 12CM204, & 14CF240  @ 9:49 am.  State has reviewed revocation packet today, 12CF164, Motion in revoke deferred judgment,  557 days time served, Completed on all sentencing after revocation cases, Civil judgment on cost, Restitution owed to father & does not wish to be paid, Restitution for other victims will be entered into civil judgment. 12CF164 ct 3 Court will revoke defer judgment agreement, 9-22-15 @ 2 pm. Sentencing, 14CF240 Atty Laufenberg has copy of information, waives reading, Atty Laufenberg 12CF164 does not object to revoke, 14CF240 Reserve rights, Not guilty plea, Status 9-22-15 @ 2 pm, Court receives not guilty plea. 12CF164, State heard on bond, no unsupervised contact with minor females.  Atty Laufenberg will not object.  Court orders bond of 2500 cash bond, no unsupervised contact with any females under the age of 18. Now sentencing after revocation case. State has nothing further. ct 1 9 months jail, completed ct 2 9 months jail, ct 4 9 months jail, ct 5 9 months jail, all concurrent, completed.  10 days to come up with figure on Restitution.  Parties discuss on case after revocation. Atty Laufenberg gives statement.  No changes  or corrections to revocation packet. Def. makes statement. 
Court orders Any outstanding obligations or fines will converted to civil judgment on revocation case.  Any restitution excepts for fathers restitution be entered to civil judgment. Father is in court & would not like to enter judgment. 12CF134 - 1 year jail, credit 557 days, completed
12CF164 ct's 1 2 4 & 5 - 9 months jail on each ct, concurrent to each other & 12CF134, 557 days credit
12CM194 - 9 months jail, concurrent with all previous case & 557 days credit
12CM204  30 days jail, concurrent to other case, credit for time served & completed. 
Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Defendant Tyler J. Brand in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Tyler J. Brand in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:53 a.m. Ofc. Brady Goeks duly sworn on oath, testifies. Arguments given by Atty Laufenberg. Response by State. 11:03 recess. 11:08 Court resumes. Court has reviewed jury instruction. Court finds probable cause and binds over. State asks for 10 days to file information. Court grants.  Arraignment scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Copy to parties 6-2-15

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def is on probation hold.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  Bond will continue  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 10:45 am.
